fields.name: code
fields.desc: barcode of the product (can be EAN-13 or internal codes for some food stores), for products without a barcode, Open Food Facts assigns a number starting with the 200 reserved prefix

fields.name: url
fields.desc: url of the product page on Open Food Facts

fields.name: creator
fields.desc: contributor who first added the product

fields.name: created_t
fields.desc: date that the product was added (UNIX timestamp format)

fields.name: created_datetime
fields.desc: date that the product was added (iso8601 format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mn:ssZ)

fields.name: last_modified_t
fields.desc: date that the product page was last modified (UNIX timestamp format)

fields.name: last_modified_datetime
fields.desc: date that the product page was last modified (iso8601 format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mn:ssZ)

fields.name: last_modified_by
fields.desc: contributor who last modified the product

fields.name: last_updated_t
fields.desc: date that the product was last updated (UNIX timestamp format)

fields.name: last_updated_datetime
fields.desc: date that the product was last updated (iso8601 format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mn:ssZ)

fields.name: product_name
fields.desc: name of the product

fields.name: abbreviated_product_name
fields.desc: shortened version of the product's name

fields.name: generic_name
fields.desc: common name or generic description of the product, used to define the product when the specific product name is not available or when a more general term is needed

fields.name: quantity
fields.desc: quantity and unit
fields.comment: Sometimes there is no unit

fields.name: packaging
fields.desc: the list of information about packaging material. Most relevant data is the substance of the packaging and its shape.
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma

fields.name: packaging_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the information about packaging material of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: packaging_en
fields.desc: list of the product's packaging in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: packaging_text
fields.desc: packaging text as presented on the product

fields.name: brands
fields.desc: the brands of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. The main brand, generally clearly displayed on the front pack, should be entered first.

fields.name: brands_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the brands of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: categories
fields.desc: the specific category of the product and its related parents
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. This field is very important: it needs to be completed for Nutri-Score computation, as this computation makes differences between types of products (beverages, ...)

fields.name: categories_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the categories of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: categories_en
fields.desc: list of the products' categories in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: origins
fields.desc: origins of the product's ingredients
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: origins_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the origins of the product's ingredients
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: origins_en
fields.desc: list of the origins of the product's ingredients in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: manufacturing_places
fields.desc: places where manufactured or transformed
fields.comment: You should enter this data like an address: the most precise information first and the most general at the end. It is usually represented by city,state/province,country. Sometimes elements in this representation are missing or are in another order.

fields.name: manufacturing_places_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the manufacturing places of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: labels
fields.desc: any characteristic of the product which is factual and different from the other fields: organic, vegetarian, religious, origins, rating labels when they are displayed on the product etc.
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: labels_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the labels of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: labels_en
fields.desc: list of the labels of the product in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: emb_codes
fields.desc: dedicated for various codes related to packaging marks, identification marks or health marks (traceability code), not only for emb_codes
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. The EMB code is EMB 00000XX where 00000 are five numbers and XX can be absent or one or several letters. The code of l'agrément sanitaire européen, which is CC 00 111 222 CE where CC is the code of the country, 00 is the département number, 111 is the commune number, 222 is the production company number and CE means that the origin of the products is in the EU. There are also other types of codes in this field.

fields.name: emb_codes_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the emb codes of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: first_packaging_code_geo
fields.desc: coordinates corresponding to the first packaging code indicated: coordinate1,coordinate2

fields.name: cities
fields.desc: list of cities where the product is available or has been purchased
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. This field seems to always be empty in the csv file.

fields.name: cities_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the cities where the product is available or has been purchased
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: purchase_places
fields.desc: list of locations where the product can be purchased
fields.comment: It is usually represented by city,state/province,country. Sometimes elements in this representation are missing or are in another order.

fields.name: stores
fields.desc: list of stores where the product can be purchased
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: countries
fields.desc: list of countries where the product is sold
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. In 2021, the United Nation recognize 193 countries but Open Food Facts also recognize other territories, such as overseas regions/territories such as French Guiana, Guadeloupe, French Polynesia, etc.

fields.name: countries_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the countries where the product is sold
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: countries_en
fields.desc: list of countries where the product is sold in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: ingredients_text
fields.desc: list of the ingredients of the product as shown on the product
fields.comment: This field is one of the most important. Sometimes in english, sometimes in french (other languages?).

fields.name: ingredients_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the ingredients of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: ingredients_analysis_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize different characteristics of the product related to its ingredients (e.g. palm oil free, vegan, etc)
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each tag is lc:ingredient where lc is the code of the language used. This field is computed from ingredients' analysis to know if the product is or not vegan, vegetarian, and/or with palm-oil.

fields.name: allergens
fields.desc: known allergens present in the product (ingredients that are actually in the product, which could cause common allergies)
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is a tag : lc:allergen where lc is the code of the language used.

fields.name: allergens_en
fields.desc: list of the known allergens in the product in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. This field seems to be empty for every product.

fields.name: traces
fields.desc: ingredients which are not used for the product itself but lay in the factory or the production process: the product might contain traces of these ingredients
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is lc:trace where lc is the code of the language used. Traces are really important if you are allergic.

fields.name: traces_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the traces present in the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is lc:trace_tag where lc is the code of the language used.

fields.name: traces_en
fields.desc: list of the traces present in the product in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: serving_size
fields.desc: serving size in g
fields.comment: Allowed units are: kg, g, mg, µg, oz, l, dl, cl, ml, fl.oz, fl oz, г, мг, кг, л, дл, кл, мл, 毫克, 公斤, 毫升, 公升, 吨. Decimals can be written with a comma (,) or a point (.). Sometimes there is additional information (e.g. the number of units corresponding to the serving size in g, like 2 pieces).

fields.name: serving_quantity
fields.desc: only quantity of the serving size, expressed in g or ml depending on the nature of the product

fields.name: no_nutrition_data
fields.desc: indicates if the nutrition facts are indicated on the food label
fields.comment: Observed values : on, off, true, null

fields.name: additives_n
fields.desc: number of food additives

fields.name: additives
fields.desc: list of additives present in the product
fields.comment: Each element has the format [ additive -> additive_tag ] or [ additive -> additive_tag -> exists -- ok ]

fields.name: additives_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the additives present in the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is lc:additive where lc is the code of the language.

fields.name: additives_en
fields.desc: list of the additives present in the product in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is lc:additive where lc is the code of the language.

fields.name: nutriscore_score
fields.desc: the nutriscore score attributed to the product based on the official computation of the score

fields.name: nutriscore_grade
fields.desc: nutrition grade ('a' to 'e') based on the computed product's nutriscore score and the official convert table. see https://fr.openfoodfacts.org/nutriscore

fields.name: nova_group
fields.desc: nova group of the product (from 1 to 4)

fields.name: pnns_groups_1
fields.desc: primary food group based on the nature and the nutritional composition of the product and on the pnns
fields.comment: Observed values: Beverages; Fruits and vegetables; Cereal and potatoes; Milk and dairy products; Fish Meat Eggs; Fat and sauces; Sugary snacks; Salty snacks; Composite foods; Alcoholic beverages. For more: https://www.cerin.org/articles/groupes-groupes-daliments/

fields.name: pnns_groups_2
fields.desc: food subgroup based on the nature and the nutritional composition of the product and on the pnns
fields.comment: Observed values: Artificially sweetened beverages; Unsweetened beverages; Sweetened beverages; Dried fruits; Sandwiches; One-dish meals; Biscuits and cakes; Cereals; Nuts; Sweets; Plant-based milk substitutes; Fats; Chocolate products; Fruit juices; Vegetables; Dressings and sauces; Fruit nectars; Bread; Ice cream; Legumes; Cheese; Meat; Fish and seafood; Pizza pies and quiches; Processed meat; Alcoholic beverages; Breakfast cereals; Fruits; Dairy desserts; Potatoes; Milk and yogurt; Appetizers; Soups; Teas and herbal teas and coffees; Salty and fatty products; Pastries; Offals; Waters and flavored waters; Eggs; Pizza pies and quiche; Non-sugared beverages. For more: https://www.cerin.org/articles/groupes-groupes-daliments/

fields.name: food_groups
fields.desc: food group based on the nature and the nutritional composition of the product
fields.comment: represented by lc:group where lc is the code of the language. Seems to often be the same group as in the pnns_groups_2 field.

fields.name: food_groups_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the food groups of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is represented by lc:group where lc is the code of the language. Seems to have the values of pnns_groups_1 and pnns_groups_2.

fields.name: food_groups_en
fields.desc: list of the food groups of the product in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: states
fields.desc: list of the states indicating various levels of completeness and verification of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is represented by lc:state where lc is the code for the language. To see all the possible states of a product, see: https://world.openfoodfacts.org/states

fields.name: states_tags
fields.desc: list of tags categorizing the various levels of completeness and verification of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is represented by lc:state where lc is the code for the language.

fields.name: states_en
fields.desc: list of the states indicating various levels of completeness and verification of the product in english
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma.

fields.name: brand_owner
fields.desc: company that owns or distributes the food brand of the product

fields.name: environmental_score_score
fields.desc: numerical score that quantifies the product’s environmental impact
fields.comment: This number can be negative. How to compute it: https://docs.score-environnemental.com/methodologie-recette/fonctionnement-general-recette

fields.name: environmental_score_grade
fields.desc: environmental score grade ('a-plus' to 'f') based on the computed product's environmental score and the convert table.

fields.name: nutrient_levels_tags
fields.desc: list of tags categorizing the levels (low, moderate, high) of the nutrients of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is lc:level where lc is the code for the language. This field represents the traffic lights system made by the UK FSA (Food Safety Administration). It is used by some manufacturers on a voluntary basis in Great Britain, but was rejected by the European Commission in 2010. On Open Food Facts, when the nutritional values are known, the traffic lights are displayed on the product pages. The calculation formula defining the colors of the lights is described on a dedicated page of Open Food Facts website: https://world.openfoodfacts.org/nutrition-traffic-lights. Nutrient levels can be found here on the website: https://world.openfoodfacts.org/nutrient-levels

fields.name: product_quantity
fields.desc: the normalized quantity of the product in grams (ISO system)

fields.name: owner
fields.desc: the owner of the product, which have sent the product's data to Open Food Facts
fields.comment: The list of owners can be found at https://world.openfoodfacts.org/owners

fields.name: data_quality_errors_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the data quality errors of the product
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. Each element is lc:error where lc is the code for the language. To see the list of all the data quality error: https://world.openfoodfacts.org/data-quality-errors or https://wiki.openfoodfacts.org/List_of_data_quality_errors_(generated)

fields.name: unique_scans_n
fields.desc: the number of users who have scanned the product at least one time
fields.comment: 'Users' are identified by different IPs. This value is not computed in real time but once a year.

fields.name: popularity_tags
fields.desc: list of tags that categorize the group of the product by different levels of popularity by year, either in the world, either in the countries where it is popular
fields.comment: In the csv file this list is represented by a string with each element separated by a comma. The popularity tags do no have the language code at the beginning. The popularity of a product is computed thanks to its number of unique scans.

fields.name: completeness
fields.desc: Percentage of completeness of the product data, between 0 and 1.
fields.comment: In 2019, more than 10 items were checked: image completeness, product_name, quantity, packaging, brands, categories, origins, emb_codes, expiration_date, ingreditents_text, nutriments (or no_nutrition_data if it is on). This may have changed.

fields.name: last_image_t
fields.desc: the date (Unix format) of the last image being uploaded for the product

fields.name: last_image_datetime
fields.desc: the date (iso8601 format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mn:ssZ) of the last image being uploaded for the product

fields.name: main_category
fields.desc: the tag of the specific category of the product
fields.comment: The tag is expressed by lc:category where lc is the code for the country.

fields.name: main_category_en
fields.desc: the specific category of the product in english
fields.comment: The main category is expressed in the same language as in the main_category field. This should be corrected.

fields.name: image_url
fields.desc: url of the product's front image used in Open Food Facts

fields.name: image_small_url
fields.desc: url of the product's front image in lower quality used in Open Food Facts

fields.name: image_ingredients_url
fields.desc: url of the list of ingredients on the product's packaging image used in Open Food Facts

fields.name: image_ingredients_small_url
fields.desc: url of the list of ingredients on the product's packaging image in lower quality used in Open Food Facts

fields.name: image_nutrition_url
fields.desc: url of the nutrition table on the product's packaging image used in Open Food Facts

fields.name: image_nutrition_small_url
fields.desc: url of the nutrition table on the product's packaging image in lower quality used in Open Food Facts

fields.name: energy-kj_100g
fields.desc: the amount of energy (in kj) per 100 grams of the product

fields.name: energy-kcal_100g
fields.desc: the amount of energy (in kcal) per 100 grams of the product

fields.name: energy_100g
fields.desc: the amount of energy (in kj) per 100 grams of the product

fields.name: energy-from-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of energy (in kj) derived from fat per 100 grams of the product

fields.name: fat_100g
fields.desc: the total amount of fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: saturated-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of saturated fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: butyric-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of butyric acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: caproic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of caproic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: caprylic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of caprylic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: capric-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of capric acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: lauric-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of lauric acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: myristic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of myristic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: palmitic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of palmitic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: stearic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of stearic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: arachidic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of arachidic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: behenic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of behenic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: lignoceric-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of lignoceric acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: cerotic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of cerotic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: montanic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of montanic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: melissic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of melissic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: unsaturated-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of unsaturated fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: monounsaturated-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of monounsaturated fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: omega-9-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of omega 9 fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: polyunsaturated-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of polyunsaturated fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: omega-3-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of omega 3 fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: omega-6-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of omega 6 fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: alpha-linolenic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of alpha-linolenic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: eicosapentaenoic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of eicosapentaenoic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: docosahexaenoic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of docosahexaenoic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: linoleic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of linoleic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: arachidonic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of arachidonic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: gamma-linolenic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of gamma-linolenic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: dihomo-gamma-linolenic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of dihomo-gamma-linolenic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: oleic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of oleic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: elaidic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of elaidic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: gondoic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of gondoic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: mead-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of mead acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: erucic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of erucic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: nervonic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of nervonic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: trans-fat_100g
fields.desc: the amount of saturated fat in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: cholesterol_100g
fields.desc: the amount of cholesterol in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: carbohydrates_100g
fields.desc: the amount of carbohydrates in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: sugars_100g
fields.desc: the amount of sugars in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: added-sugars_100g
fields.desc: the amount of added sugars in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: sucrose_100g
fields.desc: the amount of sucrose in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: glucose_100g
fields.desc: the amount of glucose in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: fructose_100g
fields.desc: the amount of fructose in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: lactose_100g
fields.desc: the amount of lactose in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: maltose_100g
fields.desc: the amount of maltose in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: maltodextrins_100g
fields.desc: the amount of maltodextrins in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: starch_100g
fields.desc: the amount of starch in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: polyols_100g
fields.desc: the amount of polyols (sugar alcohols) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: erythritol_100g
fields.desc: the amount of erythritol in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: fiber_100g
fields.desc: the amount of fiber in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: soluble-fiber_100g
fields.desc: the amount of soluble fiber in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: insoluble-fiber_100g
fields.desc: the amount of insoluble fiber in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: proteins_100g
fields.desc: the amount of proteins in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: casein_100g
fields.desc: the amount of casein in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: serum-proteins_100g
fields.desc: the amount of serum proteins in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: nucleotides_100g
fields.desc: the amount of nucleotides in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: salt_100g
fields.desc: the amount of salt in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: added-salt_100g
fields.desc: the amount of added salt in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: sodium_100g
fields.desc: the amount of sodium in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: alcohol_100g
fields.desc: % vol of alcohol

fields.name: vitamin-a_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin A in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product
fields.comment: This field corresponds to the retinol value.

fields.name: beta-carotene_100g
fields.desc: the amount of beta carotene in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-d_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin D (D3) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-e_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin E in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-k_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin K in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-c_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin C (ascorbic acid) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-b1_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin B1 (thiamin) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-b2_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin B2 (riboflavin) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-pp_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin B3/PP (niacin) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-b6_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin B6 (pyridoxin) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-b9_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin B9 (folic acid) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: folates_100g
fields.desc: the amount of folates (total folates) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: vitamin-b12_100g
fields.desc: the amount of vitamin B12 (cobalamin) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: biotin_100g
fields.desc: the amount of biotin in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product8
fields.comment: Also known as Vitamin B8.

fields.name: pantothenic-acid_100g
fields.desc: the amount of pantothenic acid in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product
fields.comment: Also known as Vitamin B5.

fields.name: silica_100g
fields.desc: the amount of silica in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: bicarbonate_100g
fields.desc: the amount of bicarbonate in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: potassium_100g

fields.desc: % of fruits, vegetables and nuts (excluding potatoes, yams, manioc)

fields.name: fruits-vegetables-nuts-dried_100g
fields.desc: the percentage of dried fruits, vegetables and nuts in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: collagen-meat-protein-ratio_100g

fields.name: cocoa_100g
fields.desc: the (minimum) percentage of cocoa in the product

fields.name: chlorophyl_100g
fields.desc: the amount of chlorophyl in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: carbon-footprint_100g
fields.desc: carbon footprint (as indicated on the packaging of some products)

fields.name: carbon-footprint-from-meat-or-fish_100g
fields.desc: carbon footprint from the meat or the fish ingredients in the product

fields.name: nutrition-score-fr_100g
fields.desc: Nutri-Score - Nutrition score derived from the UK FSA score and adapted for the French market (formula defined by the team of Professor Hercberg)

fields.name: nutrition-score-uk_100g
fields.desc: nutrition score defined by the UK Food Standards Administration (FSA)

fields.name: glycemic-index_100g
fields.desc: glycemic index (0 to 100) per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: water-hardness_100g
fields.desc: water hardness (concentration of calcium and magnesium ions in the water) of the product

fields.name: choline_100g
fields.desc: the amount of choline in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: phylloquinone_100g
fields.desc: the amount of phylloquinone (vitamin K1) in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: beta-glucan_100g
fields.desc: the amount of beta-glucan in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: inositol_100g
fields.desc: the amount of inositol in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: carnitine_100g
fields.desc: the amount of carnitine in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: sulphate_100g
fields.desc: the amount of sulphate in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: nitrate_100g
fields.desc: the amount of nitrate in grams per 100g or 100ml of the product

fields.name: acidity_100g
fields.desc: the percentage of acidity of the product

comments: Fields that end with _t are dates in the UNIX timestamp format (number of seconds since Jan 1st 1970)
Fields that end with _datetime are dates in the ISO8601 format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mn:ssZ
Fields that end with _tags are comma-separated list of tags (e.g. categories_tags is the set of normalized tags computer from the categories field)
Fields that end with a language 2 letter code (e.g. fr for French) is the set of tags in that language
Fields that end with _100g correspond to the amount of a nutriment (in g) for 100 g or 100 ml of product
